intro: Indigofera gifbergensis, commonly known as the Gifberg indigo, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect shrub growth habit. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Indigofera gifbergensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
